title: Circular motion - maximum speed in curve

content.description: Two cars <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> are driven on a section of road that has a circular curve. When both cars are driven through the curve at their maximum speeds before they slip on the road, the centripetal acceleration of Car <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi> </math> is twice that of Car <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>. The maximum speed Car <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> can drive through the curve without slipping is <math alttext="10 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>.
content.question: Which of the following is closest to the maximum speed Car <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> can drive through the curve without slipping?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
